intro: Panzerina lanata var. alaschanica, commonly known as the Alashan hairy panzerina, is a rare and unique plant species native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a subtle floral presence to its habitat. Its adaptability to extreme conditions makes it an important species for studying desert flora. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
